Conquest (2016 population: ) is a village in the Canadian province of Saskatchewan within the Rural Municipality of Fertile Valley No. 285 and Census Division No. 12.
History
Conquest incorporated as a village on October 24, 1911.
Demographics
|1981|256
|1986|221
|1991|224
|1996|195

|2011|176
|2016|160

In the 2021 Census of Population conducted by Statistics Canada, Conquest had a population of  living in  of its  total private dwellings, a change of |160|1}} from its 2016 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of  in 2021.
In the 2016 Census of Population, the Village of Conquest recorded a population of  living in  of its  total private dwellings, a |160|1}} change from its 2011 population of . With a land area of , it had a population density of  in 2016.
Arts and culture
Conquest was the setting for the 1998 film Conquest.
